intro: Galium flaviflorum, commonly known as yellow wood-roe, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium flaviflorum is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
